javadoc.text:
* A linear constraint for a linear optimization problem. *
* A linear constraint has one of the forms: * *
c1x1 + ... cnxn = v *
c1x1 + ... cnxn <= v *
c1x1 + ... cnxn >= v *
l1x1 + ... lnxn + lcst = * r1x1 + ... rnxn + rcst *
l1x1 + ... lnxn + lcst <= * r1x1 + ... rnxn + rcst *
l1x1 + ... lnxn + lcst >= * r1x1 + ... rnxn + rcst * * The ci, li or ri are the coefficients of the constraints, the xi * are the coordinates of the current point and v is the value of the constraint. *
* Coefficients of the constraint (left hand side).
* Relationship between left and right hand sides (=, <=, >=).
* Value of the constraint (right hand side).

* Build a constraint involving a single linear equation. *
* A linear constraint with a single linear equation has one of the forms: * *
c1x1 + ... cnxn = v *
c1x1 + ... cnxn <= v *
c1x1 + ... cnxn >= v * *
javadoc.param: coefficients The coefficients of the constraint (left hand side)
relationship The type of (in)equality used in the constraint
value The value of the constraint (right hand side)

javadoc.text:
* Build a constraint involving a single linear equation. *
* A linear constraint with a single linear equation has one of the forms: * *
c1x1 + ... cnxn = v *
c1x1 + ... cnxn <= v *
c1x1 + ... cnxn >= v * *
javadoc.param: coefficients The coefficients of the constraint (left hand side)
relationship The type of (in)equality used in the constraint
value The value of the constraint (right hand side)

javadoc.text:
* Build a constraint involving two linear equations. *
* A linear constraint with two linear equation has one of the forms: * *
l1x1 + ... lnxn + lcst = * r1x1 + ... rnxn + rcst *
l1x1 + ... lnxn + lcst <= * r1x1 + ... rnxn + rcst *
l1x1 + ... lnxn + lcst >= * r1x1 + ... rnxn + rcst * *
javadoc.param: lhsCoefficients The coefficients of the linear expression on the left hand side of the constraint
lhsConstant The constant term of the linear expression on the left hand side of the constraint
relationship The type of (in)equality used in the constraint
rhsCoefficients The coefficients of the linear expression on the right hand side of the constraint
rhsConstant The constant term of the linear expression on the right hand side of the constraint

javadoc.text:
* Build a constraint involving two linear equations. *
* A linear constraint with two linear equation has one of the forms: * *
l1x1 + ... lnxn + lcst = * r1x1 + ... rnxn + rcst *
l1x1 + ... lnxn + lcst <= * r1x1 + ... rnxn + rcst *
l1x1 + ... lnxn + lcst >= * r1x1 + ... rnxn + rcst * *
javadoc.param: lhsCoefficients The coefficients of the linear expression on the left hand side of the constraint
lhsConstant The constant term of the linear expression on the left hand side of the constraint
relationship The type of (in)equality used in the constraint
rhsCoefficients The coefficients of the linear expression on the right hand side of the constraint
rhsConstant The constant term of the linear expression on the right hand side of the constraint

javadoc.text: * Gets the coefficients of the constraint (left hand side).
javadoc.return: the coefficients of the constraint (left hand side).

javadoc.text: * Gets the relationship between left and right hand sides.
javadoc.return: the relationship between left and right hand sides.

javadoc.text: * Gets the value of the constraint (right hand side).
javadoc.return: the value of the constraint (right hand side).

javadoc.param: oos stream where object should be written
javadoc.throws: IOException if object cannot be written to stream

javadoc.param: ois stream from which the object should be read
javadoc.throws: ClassNotFoundException if a class in the stream cannot be found
IOException if object cannot be read from the stream
